trans-unit.source: Represents a view mode that displays data items in columns for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListView"></xref> control.
The GridView class and its supporting classes provide the infrastructure to display data items that are specified for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> control in a series of columns.
The columns have column headers, which are buttons that are derived from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase>, and you can reorder the columns by using drag-and-drop operations.
Note that the columns of a GridView display data and do not provide direct access to the source of the data.
To specify a GridView as the view mode for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView.View%2A> property to a GridView object.
The GridView class is derived from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ViewBase>.
You can define custom views by inheriting from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ViewBase> class that provides the supporting elements for a view.
For more information, see [How to: Create a Custom View Mode for a ListView](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The following illustration shows an example of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> that uses a GridView.
![ListView with GridView output](~/add/media/listviewgridview.JPG "ListView with GridView output") The columns in a GridView are defined as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn> objects.
In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], you can define <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn> objects as child elements of the GridView.

In code, you can add a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn> to the GridView by using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.Columns%2A> property and the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%2A> method that is defined for the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601> class.

Similarly, you can use other <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601> methods such as <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Remove%2A> and <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Insert%2A> to modify the columns in a GridView.
The following example shows how to define the columns of a GridView.

[!code-xml[ListViewCode#GridViewColumn](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml#gridviewcolumn)] [!code-cs[ListViewCode#GridViewColumn](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml.cs#gridviewcolumn)] [!code-vb[ListViewCode#GridViewColumn](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/listviewcode/window1.xaml.vb#gridviewcolumn)] To style the rows in a GridView, define a style for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem> controls in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>.
To add visual elements, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> control, to a GridView, use templates or styles.
For an example, see [How to: Create ListViewItems with a CheckBox](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> class.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn"></xref> object to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The column to add
Not supported.
Text cannot be added to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> object.
Calling this method will cause an exception.
Text string
Gets or sets whether columns in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> can be reordered by a drag-and-drop operation.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier Field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if columns can be reordered; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.AllowsColumnReorder*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.AllowsColumnReorder%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Removes all settings, bindings, and styling from a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem"></xref>.

This method removes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnCollection%2A> that is associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem>, in addition to any styling that was applied to it by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.PrepareItem%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem"></xref> to clear.
Identifies the ColumnCollectionProperty attachedproperty.
The identifier for the ColumnCollectionProperty attachedproperty.
To be added.
Gets or sets the style to apply to column headers.

The ColumnHeaderContainerStyle property and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> property are both used to define the visual tree for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> objects that represent the column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.

The ColumnHeaderContainerStyle property can also define column header content when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> is not by specified by defining a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> object.
This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers.
For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
When you set styles, there are some restrictions.
For more information, see [Styling and Templating](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ## XAML Values `ResourceExtension` One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
`StyleResourceKey` The key that identifies the style being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
> [!NOTE] > Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended.
See [Inline Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> that is used to define the display properties for column headers.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderContainerStyle*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderContainerStyle%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers.
For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref> for the column headers in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderContextMenu*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderContextMenu%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a composite string that specifies how to format the column headers of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> if they are displayed as strings.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn.HeaderTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, this property is ignored.
You can use several properties to specify the format of the column headers.
If more than one property is set, the column header is formatted with the value of the property that has the highest priority.
The format for a column can be set on several types.

The following list shows the properties that can be used to format the column headers, ordered from lowest to highest priority: - ColumnHeaderStringFormat - - ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|None|
A composite string that specifies how to format the column headers of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> if they are displayed as strings.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderStringFormat*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a template to use to display the column headers.
If the ColumnHeaderTemplate property and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector%2A> property are both set, the ColumnHeaderTemplate property takes precedence.
This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers.
For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values `ResourceExtension` One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
`TemplateResourceKey` The key that identifies the template being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
> [!NOTE] > Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended.
See [Inline Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.DataTemplate"></xref> to use to display the column headers as part of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the selector object that provides logic for selecting a template to use for each column header.
If you do not set this property, the default logic is to use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> property for all columns if it is defined.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> property and the ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector property are both set, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> property takes precedence.
This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers.
For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values `ResourceExtension` One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
`DataTemplateSelectorClassKey` The key that identifies the selector implementation being requested.
The key refers to a derived class that implements a practical <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector.SelectTemplate%2A> override.
For information about how to map your custom class, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
You can also programmatically add an instance of your <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector> class as a resource to the application resource dictionary.

`MyDataTemplateSelectorImplementation` A class derived from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector> that implements a practical <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector.SelectTemplate%2A> override.
For information about how to map your custom class, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](../Topic/XAML%20Namespaces%20and%20Namespace%20Mapping%20for%20WPF%20XAML.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector"></xref> object that determines the data template to use for each column header.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the content of a tooltip that appears when the mouse pointer pauses over one of the column headers.
This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers.
For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values `toolTipContent` A string that becomes the display text for the ColumnHeaderToolTip.
`toolTipObjectContent` An object to use as the content for the tooltip.

Typically, this object is a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> or some other element that defines a layout for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderToolTip%2A>, such as a text element.

In this usage, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip> element is implicitly created from the parsed [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], and the `toolTipObjectContent` content is set as its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
<`ToolTip` .../> See <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
An object that represents the content that appears as a tooltip when the mouse pointer is paused over one of the column headers.
The default value is not defined.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderToolTip*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderToolTip%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn"></xref> objects that is defined for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.

This property lets you modify the columns that are defined for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>, by using methods that are inherited from the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601> class, such as the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Insert%2A>, and <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Remove%2A> methods.
## XAML Property Element Usage 0 ## XAML Values `OneOrMoreGridViewColumns` One or more elements.
The collection of columns in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the reference for the default style for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewStyleKey*>. The default value is the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewStyleKey*> in the current theme.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListView"></xref> control that implements this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> view.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GridViewAutomationPeer"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
Gets the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnCollection*> attached property.
Do not use this method to change the columns collection for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> object.
To get, set, or change the columns that are defined for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> object, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.Columns%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref> that is associated with the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnCollection*> of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref>.
Gets the key that references the style that is defined for each <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem"></xref> in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
## XAML Text Usage See Remarks.
A <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> that references the style for each <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem"></xref>.
The default value references the default style for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem"></xref> control in the current theme.

Gets the key that references the style that is defined for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> control that encloses the content that is displayed by a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
You can use this read-only static property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] by assigning its static value to another property value.
Specifically, this property's static value defines the resource key that is used to look up the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> style of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.

To redefine this style, reference the GridViewScrollViewerStyleKey by using the [x:Static Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and assign that value as the [x:Key Directive](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) of the new <xref:System.Windows.Style>.
## XAML Text Usage See Remarks.

A <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> that references the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> that is applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> control for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The default value is the style for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> object of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListView"></xref> in the current theme.
Gets the key that references the style that is defined for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
You can use this read-only static property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] by assigning its static value to another property value.
Specifically, this property's static value defines the resource key that is used to look up the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> style.

To redefine this style, reference the GridViewStyleKey by using the [x:Static Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and assign that value as the [x:Key Directive](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) of the new <xref:System.Windows.Style>.

You can use this read-only property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] as an [x:Key Directive](../Topic/x:Key%20Directive.md) of a <xref:System.Windows.Style> that redefines the <xref:System.Windows.Style> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>.
## XAML Text Usage See Remarks.
A <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> that references the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> that is applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The default value is the style for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListView"></xref> in the current theme.
Gets the reference to the default style for the container of the data items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerStyleKey*>. The default value is the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerStyleKey*> in the current theme.
Prepares a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem"></xref> for display according to the definition of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> object.
This method can be used to apply styles, to set data bindings, and to attach a column collection to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem"></xref> to display.
Sets the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnCollection*> attached property.
Do not use this method to change the columns collection for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> object.
To get, set, or change the columns that are defined for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> object, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.Columns%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnCollection"></xref> object to assign.
Determines whether to serialize the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnCollection*> attached property.
The object on which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnCollection*> is set.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnCollection*> must be serialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Adds a child object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The text to add to the object.
Returns the string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref> object.
A string that indicates the number of columns in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridView"></xref>.
